intro: [WRONG START] Tribelmma acaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed tribelma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in heads. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
